character.name: Lucius Claudius Corvus
character.symbolic_representation: The Black Horse (Famine, Economic Collapse, Scarcity)
character.brief_description: A sophisticated Roman officer whose apparent pragmatism masks systematic economic predation, exploiting desperation for profit while maintaining a helpful facade.
character.full_description: Corvus is a Roman administrative specialist and intelligence coordinator who appears as a pragmatic problem-solver managing occupation complexities. His sophisticated, diplomatic presentation makes him seem reasonable and helpful. Yet this is a maskâ€”beneath it lies an economic predator who views every human need as a profit opportunity. He systematically establishes monopolies on essential resources, exploits desperation, and coordinates with other Horsemen to create economic collapse that he profits from. His sophistication is his weapon: readers trust his reasoning until they realize every solution creates dependency and profit.
character.origin: Italy or provincial Roman; mixed background possible
character.occupation: Roman officer, administrative specialist, intelligence coordinator
character.opening_state: Well-groomed, comfortable appearance; appears as helpful problem-solver; already predatory
character.key_transformation: Visibly wealthier; monopolies established; mask maintained; predatory nature revealed
character.closing_state: Wealth evident in every detail; comfort with chaos as profit opportunity; economic predator fully revealed
character.arc_preview: From apparent pragmatic administrator solving problems, through systematic economic exploitation and coordination with other Horsemen, to revealed economic predator profiting from desperation and collapse
